page.topic: How to Specify an Alternate Configuration File for the Alpha Anywhere Classic Application Server
page.description: The Classic Application Server allows for an alternate configuration file to be specified. This is done through the use of a command line option, CONFIGFILE. For example, to launch the Application Server using a configuration file named TestConfig.xml in the root of the server's C drive:

description.p: A command line such as this example could be run from a command prompt directly, saved as a shortcut, or used with third-party tools that launch and/or manage programs.

If the specified configuration file is not found, a warning will be displayed and startup will be aborted. To create a new configuration file, you may either create a new, empty file which the Application Server will then populate with defaults, or you may make a copy of an existing configuration file, start the Application Server, and then modify settings as desired.

section.note: CONFIGFILE is only supported by the Alpha Anywhere Classic Application Server (A5ApplicationServer.exe). If specified when starting the Alpha Anywhere Development server (Alpha5.exe), the CONFIGFILE parameter will be ignored.
